results.title: The Serve with Billie Jean King
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On Tennis”.
Billie Jean King, Vic Braden and Erik Van Dellen start with the simple ‘flat’ serve, then move on to demonstrate the ‘slice’ and the ‘twist’, with detailed coverage of such basics as stance and grip, step and weight transfer, co-ordinating the toss with the swing, and proper follow-through.

results.title: On nature's trail
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society and Jason Rosenfield
results.brief_description: Four young nature enthusiasts meet each Saturday morning in their local park where they let their imagination roam free, while learning many principles of ecology as they relate to everyday life. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students.

results.title: Interviews
results.creator_credit: Mike Crisp, Harris Watts and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “On camera: the BBC video production course”.
Deals with interview techniques both inside and outside the studio. Shows how to shoot an interview using either one or two cameras. Diagrams are used to relate camera position, interviewer and guest to what appears on the scree. The importance of cutaways, shot sizes and the positioning of props are also covered.

results.title: Editing
results.creator_credit: Mike Crisp, Harris Watts and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On camera: the BBC video production course”.
Two versions of an item about a factory that has introduced morning exercises for its workers. Shows how the same material can be edited in different ways to change the shape of the story. There is also a demonstration of how interviews can be edited to greatest advantage and how shots can be juxtaposed to make the best use of materials.

results.title: Camera
results.creator_credit: Mike Crisp, Harris Watts and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On camera: the BBC video production course”.
Consist of four parts: 1. The “Camera and the eye”. Shows the difficulties faced by the camera lens as compared by the eye and notes the advantages of the camera. 2. “Lenses and apertures”. Explains focal length, angle of view, depth of field, aperture openings, the times 2 extender and the gain switch. 3. “Short sizes and camera moves”. Explains basic terminology - such as pan, tilt, depress, track and zoom. 4. “Crossing the line” Shows how to mantain continuity of direction to avoid confusing the viewer.

results.title: Three looms waiting
results.creator_credit: Ronald Smedley and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Omnibus”
Portrait of an English drama teacher, Dorothy Heathcote. Shows her work in Tyneside with a variety of young people from an approved school, a junior school, and a hospital for the mentally handicapped.
Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.
